Client.Name: End-Use Load Profiles for the U.S. Building Stock

Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) funded a three-year project, End-Use Load Profiles for the U.S. Building Stock, that culminated in this publicly available dataset of calibrated and validated 15-minute resolution load profiles for all major residential and commercial building types and end uses, across all climate regions in the United States. These EULPs were created by calibrating the ResStock and ComStock physics-based building stock models using many different measured datasets, as described here. This dataset includes load profiles for both the baseline building stock and the building stock with various energy efficiency, electrification, and demand flexibility upgrades applied.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) funded a three-year project, End-Use Load Profiles for the U.S. Building Stock, that culminated in this publicly available dataset of calibrated and validated 15-minute resolution load profiles for all major residential and commercial building types and end uses, across all climate regions in the United States. These EULPs were created by calibrating the ResStock and ComStock physics-based building stock models using many different measured datasets, as described here. This dataset includes load profiles for both the baseline building stock and the building stock with various energy efficiency, electrification, and demand flexibility upgrades applied.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: We developed our own platform using tools developed by Venus. In terms of data retrieval, the feature is to use scripts to traverse and execute. In terms of data download, we download the data according to the AWS command line. After downloading, we use the open source go-graphsplit of the fileddrive-team to cut it into small files of a specified size. The csv file will store the piece_cid and size information corresponding to the source file.
